home.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the house, apartment, or place where you live
work from/at home (=do your work at home instead of at a company office)
home.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: They have a beautiful home in California.
Good luck in your new home!
A family of birds made their home (=started living) under the roof.
Last night we stayed at home and watched TV.
He was spending more and more time away from home.
home.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the place where a child lived with his or her family
home.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Jack left home when he was 16.
Were you still living at home (=with your parents)?
Carrie moved out of the family home a year ago.
home.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the place where you came from or where you usually live, especially when this is the place where you feel happy and comfortable
home.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She was born in Italy, but she’s made Charleston her home.
The folks back home don’t really understand what life is like here.
home.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the country where you live, as opposed to foreign countries
home.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: auto sales at home and abroad
He’s been travelling, but he’s kept up with what’s going on back home.
home.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a house, apartment etc considered as property which you can buy or sell
home.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a place where people who are very old or sick, or children who have no family, are looked after
home.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: I could never put Dad into a home.
home.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a place in some games or sports which a player must try to reach in order to win a point
home.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He had grown up in a stable home.
Many of the youngsters came from broken homes.
The house was once the family home of the O'Dare family.
He left the marital home to move in with his lover.
I had not been back to my childhood home for ten years.
Flood victims were offered temporary homes.
More people in their twenties are still living at home because housing is so expensive.
Lisa had left home at age 16.
I work at home three days a week.
home.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: the house, apartment, or place where you live
More and more people are working from home.
It was past midnight by the time I got home.
a building that someone lives in, especially a building intended for one person, couple, or family
Shall we meet at your house?
Have you seen Dave’s new house – it’s huge!
the house, apartment, or room where someone lives
We went to Sara’s place after the movie.
He’s just bought a fantastic place right by the sea.
the house or apartment where someone lives, especially a large or official one
The prime minister’s official residence is 10 Downing Street.
His wife transferred her main residence to Spain.
a house that someone owns by the sea, in the mountains etc, where they go for their holidays
They bought a luxury holiday home in Spain.
home.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to or at the place where you live
home.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Is Sue home from work yet?
I’m going home now. See you tomorrow.
They brought the baby home from the hospital on Friday.
It was midnight by the time we got home.
What time are you coming home?
home.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with home
home.translation[1].note_box[0].items[0]: You go home, come home, or get home
What time did you get home?
I wish he’d come to home
What time did you get to home?
home.translation[1].note_box[0].items[1]: You go back home or come back home
Why don’t you go back home and rest?
home.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: relating to or belonging to your home or family
home address/number (=the address or telephone number of your house)
home.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: These children need a proper home life.
home.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: done at home or intended for use in a home
home.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: played or playing at a team’s own sports field, rather than an opponent’s field
home.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The home team took the lead after 25 minutes.
home.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: relating to a particular country, as opposed to foreign countries
home.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: The meat was destined for the home market.
home.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: connected with or happening in the country where goods are produced, rather than foreign countries
home.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: The company faces very little competition in the home market.
Home consumption of whisky has continued to decline.
home.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: to earn a particular amount of money after tax has been taken away
home.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: These workers take home just £100 a week.
